intro: Galeatella gloria-montis var. molokaiensis, commonly known as the Molokai fern, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively on the island of Molokai in Hawaii. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds that exhibit a distinctive, intricate pattern of lobes and serrations. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically in forest understories where it forms dense, low-growing clumps. Its unique morphology and restricted distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists studying island endemism and evolutionary adaptation. Conservation efforts are crucial to protect this species from habitat loss and invasive species.
